Class Squarelotron

  • java.lang.Object
    • Squarelotron
  • public class Squarelotron
extends java.lang.Object
    A squarelotron is a two dimensional array. You can manipulate the array by rotating every element in the array or by rotating specific rings in the array

      • isOnRing

        public boolean isOnRing​(int i,
                        int j,
                        int ring)

      • upsideDownFlip

        public Squarelotron upsideDownFlip​(int ring)
        This method performs the Upside-Down Flip of the squarelotron and returns the new squarelotron. The original squarelotron should not be modified.

      • mainDiagonalFlip

        public Squarelotron mainDiagonalFlip​(int ring)
        This method performs the Main Diagonal Flip of the squarelotron and returns the new squarelotron. The original squarelotron should not be modified.

      • rotateRight

        public void rotateRight​(int numberOfTurns)
        The argument numberOfTurns indicates the number of times the entire squarelotron should be rotated 90Â° clockwise. Any integer, including zero and negative integers, is allowable as the argument. A value of -1 indicates a 90Â° counterclockwise rotation. This method modifies the internal representation of the squarelotron; it does not create a new squarelotron.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
